cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles east of Caibarién, Cuba and about 380 miles southeast of Miami, Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to resume WNW later today)

cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest along the north coast of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest toward the Florida Keys and southern Florida Peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches in effect for Puerto Rico
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – no warnings in effect for Puerto Rico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and Northwestern Bahamas, north coast of Cuba, Florida Keys, southern and central Florida coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed (San Juan, PR not included in advisory #38 wind table)
weather_observation.first_hazard: Arrival of tropical storm-force winds (already occurred)
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain bands no longer expected; only occasional gusty trade winds (<34 kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Swells generating high surf and rip currents along north-facing beaches, but no significant surge inside San Juan Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers possible, but widespread heavy rainfall not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and large breaking waves along exposed Atlantic beaches.
